subject: Soccer
World Cup (Soccer)
lead_paragraph: Iraq lost its bid for reinstatement in 2010 World Cup qualifying after the sport’s highest court refused to punish Qatar for using an ineligible player. The Court of Arbitration for Sport agreed with soccer’s governing body, FIFA, that Iraq had no right to make an appeal because it was late in paying a $2,800 fee. The Iraqi Football Association missed the deadline by 11 days. The dispute stemmed from a March 26 Asian qualifier between Qatar and Iraq in Doha. The Brazilian-born Emerson was a Qatar citizen when he helped Qatar beat Iraq, 2-0. But earlier in his career, he had also played for Brazil’s under-20 team under the name of Marcio Passos De Albuquerque. FIFA lets players change nationality but not play for two countries.
